Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: U. S. Marshals
US Marshals
boardgame.description:
US Marshals is a rules-light tabletop roleplaying game that assumes the player-characters are Marshals (or Deputy Marshals) in the American Wild West, official representatives of the Federal government of the United States of America enacting the laws, subpoenas, and will of federal courts, Congress, and the President with broad-reaching jurisdiction.

All you need to play are these rules, a few scraps of paper, pencils, at least two six-sided dice (2d6), and a few friends! One person runs the game as the Gamemaster (GM), while everyone else plays as a Marshal; the more the merrier!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Fake Chess: Book of Champions
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
WHAT IS FAKE CHESS?
Chess is a game of vast complexity and a 1500-year history.

Fake Chess is not.

Fake Chess players use a very basic set of rules and mechanics to live out their grandmaster fantasies by acting like serious chess players, engaging in what looks like an intense battle without the burdens of chess strategy, knowledge, or skill.

boardgame.name: Garfield ± You
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
From the publisher:
For over thirty years, starting in the 1980s, telephones in the shape of the orange cartoon cat Garfield were found washed up on the shores of a beach in northwestern France. Nobody knew where the phones were coming from. It was a big mess, but also a little nostalgic and theoretically could be used to contact somebody far away.

This is a two player RPG about a person experiencing major milestones in their life, at which time they also are visited by Garfield. One player plays the Human, and the other plays Garfield. Garfield is also a phone.

Made for The 2020 Folklore Jam, operating under a very loose definition of folklore. Garfield is copyright Paws, Inc and is in no way my creation nor a being who exists to lure humans astray for the sake of a fell master, please do not sue me.

boardgame.name: Tome of Brutal Tactics
boardgame.description:
Tome of Brutal Tactics is a collection of combat options for use with Dungeons & Dragons.

This booklet is a collection of feats, features, optional rules and expanded class options to help bring brutal combat to life in your campaign.

Whether taking down vampire spawn with the Decapitation maneuver, making a Called Shot against a cultist of Elemental Evil, feeling an Adrenaline Rush while facing down the Tyranny of Dragons, or fighting demonic hordes in the Underdark with your Rapid Strike, these feats, features and options add a level of brutal efficiency and powerful advantage for your Dungeons and Dragons campaign.

Tome of Brutal Tactics contains the following:


General Combat Feats: 15 new feats to give your character a brutal edge in combat.
Skill Mastery Feats: 18 new feats to grant your character advantage on skills.
Weapon Style Feats: 9 new feats that expand your character's mastery of weaponry.
New Boons: 4 new boons that can be incorporated as high-level rewards or blessings.
Advanced Combat Maneuvers: 8 new maneuvers for the Battle Master or Martial Adept.
New Backgrounds: 3 new backgrounds for characters with a propensity for violence.
New Class Options: 2 new class options; the Officer Martial Archetype and the Paladin Oath of the Slayer
Rules Clarifications & Options: a section describing how some effects stack and new optional rules such as die type increases and new conditions


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Ultimate Adventurer's Handbook
boardgame.description:
The Ultimate Adventurer’s Handbook is the ultimate resource for creating new characters to play in your next Dungeons & Dragons campaign. Within this book you’ll find new races, subclasses, feats, spells, magic items, and more. In addition to new options available to every class published by Wizards of the Coast, as well as Matt Mercer’s Blood Hunter, this book features updated and expanded versions of two popular DMsGuild classes: the Accursed and the Pugilist.

If your heroes are fighting to save the world, it’s time to arm yourself with ultimate power!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Puzzles, Predicaments, and Perplexities II
boardgame.description:
Adventurers need much more than just brute force, magical powers, and nimble moves in order to survive the dangers that await them. A sharp mind is just as important as a sharp sword. When faced with a challenging puzzle, finding the solution can be the difference between victory and defeat.

Puzzles, Predicaments, and Perplexities II is the sequel to the best-selling original Puzzles, Predicaments, and Perplexities. This volume contains a collection of logic puzzles, brain teasers, and encoded sequences intended to test the problem solving and deductive reasoning of characters and players, as well as two adventures that connect these puzzles with an overall storyline. These puzzles are designed to be easily placed into any adventure with no additional work, yet also provide guidance on how Dungeon Masters can customize the details to best fit into their own campaigns.

This title includes:


15 original puzzles for use in your adventures.
2 full-length adventures for characters of all levels that connect the included puzzles with an original story.
A new “Perplexity Rating” that provides guidance on the relative difficulty of each puzzle.
Instructions on how to scale the difficulty of the puzzles for characters of all levels.
Hints for each puzzle to guide players towards the solution without simply giving it away.
Guidance for customizing the puzzles to fit into your own adventure, campaign, or original world.
Optional “Raise The Stakes” sidebars for making puzzles more deadly.
2 original maps suitable for in person or online play.
8 original hand-outs that help visualize the layout, runes, and arrangements involved with some of the puzzles.
4 unique magical items that can be found within the included puzzles and adventures.
2 original creatures confronted within the puzzles.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Star Charter
boardgame.description:
The First Sovereignty spread humanity to every corner of the galaxy, but eons have passed since its fall, and the countless worlds once under its thumb became no more than whispered legends to one another. Now, a potent new FTL advancement, which rumors say emerged from the cryptic galactic core, grants humanity the hope of travel to the farthest stars in a single lifetime. You are one of the few with the mettle to give up your planet-bound life and become a STAR CHARTER.

Star Charter is a card-driven solitaire game where you play a star charter, striking out from your home planet to travel the space lanes and the vast void, discovering long-lost worlds of a densely inhabited galaxy. When you have discovered three new worlds, you have won the game, but it is possible to become adrift in space and lose. Whether you win or lose, the known galaxy has the potential to grow with each new game.

This is a “Make-as-You-Play” game, which means that the game starts with a few materials (a map, paper, index cards, and colored cubes) and the remaining components will be generated as needed during play. Each game will see the addition of new cards, which represent the worlds in the galaxy.

The game rules include tables and guidelines for making new cards as needed, and this makes every copy of Star Charter an evolving galaxy. In addition, it means that each game inherits all components added or changed in the previous games. The galaxy’s worlds can grow endlessly over a connected campaign as players return to see what each new era holds for the future of humanity.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Bamse och Vulkanön
boardgame.description:
Travel to the North Pole with Bamse and his friends

Go on an adventure and research trip to the North Pole to look for different animals. With a little luck, you can get help from Bamse, Lille Skutt and Skalman. With a little bad luck, you risk loose some animal between the stations. To try to save your animals, you do different challenges. The one who first filled his tray with animals has won.

boardgame.name: iina
boardgame.description:
iiná is a solitaire 18-card in-hand game that places the player in control of a Navajo tribe in the 1600’s, as they fight to survive and preserve their culture during the Spanish invasion of the North American continent.

This game was developed as an entry in the 2022 In Hand Game Design Contest and was placed as follows:











—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cinema Code
시네마코드
boardgame.description:
There are illustrated cards that captured famous scenes from 80 different movies.

Cinema Code is a party game that players try to guess the movie card which is referred by the clues given by a presenter.

Game Play
(1) Set the movie cards to make a 6x5 grid.
(2) One player becomes a presenter and takes a ticket card which indicates a movie card on the table.
(3) The presenter draws a hint token from the bag and place it on any other movie card to give a clue.

There are four types of hint tokens: icons, colors, locations, and genres.
The presenter may give up to five clues.


(4) The other players look at the hint tokens and find 'the movie card' that presenter is trying to tell.

As more hints get drawn, the points players will get reduces.


(5) Replace the movie cards and the next player becomes a new presenter.

boardgame.name: Vigilante: Hidden Motives
boardgame.description:
In Hidden Motives, your super hero teams will gain a new secret hideout. The new "Lair" mechanic adds asymmetric abilities for each player including unique new actions that each player can take.

In addition to a variety of lairs, Hidden Motives adds a ton of new content to further increase variability, including Scenarios, Heroes, Villains, Identities, Equipment, and more! New abilities add a new dimension to the game, without increasing complexity.

This is an expansion, that requires Vigilante to play.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Ruins of Symbaroum Map & Art Pack
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

As the name implies, this a pack containing various maps and and art prints.

Included are:

Three large maps:
- Ambria and the forest of Davokar (front)/ The Kingdom of Ambria (back)
- Thistle Hold (front) / Blackmoor (back)
- Undarus (front) / Karvosh (back)

Four small maps:
- Salindra's Hope / Kastor
- Prios Pass / Ravenia
- The Sarli Barony / Kurun
- Ambria and the forest of Davokar
The first three of these maps are meant for specific adventure modules.

Three art prints of the illustrations that are on the cover of the core books.

boardgame.name: Lankhmar GM Screen Inserts
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Collection of 11 art panels and 4 panels with charts and tables for use with the Customizable Game Master Screen.

boardgame.name: Asking for Trobils: The Big Box
boardgame.description:
This will hold everything Trobils has to offer. Both of the Expansion boxes will fit inside.

And it will stare at you.

boardgame.name: Asking for Trobils: Metal Coins
boardgame.description: Metal Coins to replace the cardboard Coins.

boardgame.name: Asking for Trobils: Scoundrels – Ship Package 1
boardgame.description:
Each Ship type comes with a Ship card and 4 of the Ship Minis.

Contains:
The Alyssa
The Centurion Hawk

boardgame.name: Asking for Trobils: Travelers – Ship Package 2
boardgame.description:
Each Ship type comes with a Ship card and 4 of the Ship Minis.

Contains:
The T.R.O.B.A.S.
The Zemeckis

boardgame.name: Asking for Trobils: Bounty Hunters – Ship Package 3
boardgame.description:
Each Ship type comes with a Ship card and 4 of the Ship Minis.

Contains:
The Knifs's Edge
The Seeker

boardgame.name: Vigilante: Story Mode
boardgame.description:
In Story Mode, you and your friends each lead a team of heroes in an ever-changing campaign to rid the city of crime.

You will start off as agents working together in this 10-chapter campaign. Each chapter brings fun new twists, as you recruit new heroes and find useful equipment to bring from chapter to chapter.

In Chapter 1, The Agency is putting you to the test. Choose your weapon and work with your fellow agents as you combat mechanical foes.

In Chapter 2, take to the streets to take down Dino Gambino and his criminal empire. Meet new heroes, find useful gadgets, and save those in need - how you win is just as important as winning!

Vigilante: Story Mode is a standalone cooperative campaign that is compatible with Vigilante, featuring hundreds of new cards and other content to enhance your game.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Asking for Trobils: Bonus Items
boardgame.description:
Contains:
Wormhole
Bag
Ship
Ship Card
Achievement Cards

boardgame.name: Ubongo Lines
boardgame.description:
All players will try to compete by building the same pattern shown on the card as quickly as possible, using three-dimensional rectangular blocks. After 9 ores, the players add up the points. Whoever gets the most of them wins. Four difficulty levels allow you to adjust the game to the age and experience of the players.

The competition consisting in building the same pattern by all players at the same time introduces much more emotions than in the basic version or in Ubongo 3D.

This is the world's first release of this version of Ubongo!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Nowa Gwinea
boardgame.description:
We invite you on a journey to New Guinea, the second largest island in the world, a green land of endemic plants, birds of paradise and wild tribes. Play as the inhabitants of one of the tribes and build a new village. You start with the sacred animal totem and build huts of various shapes to cover ponds and as many fruit bushes as possible. Twist, turn and combine - you have one minute! And remember - huts only need to touch their horns, and other totems cannot be covered - bad luck! The player who manages to cover all water sources ends the turn. After 9 turns, the player with the most points wins.

Nowa Gwinea is a great game for the whole family. Simple rules will allow you to quickly start the game and enjoy the exciting gameplay.

The latest game from the author of PAPUA and the best-selling UBONGO series!
Tons of tasks and combinations - never get bored!
The ability to adjust the degree of difficulty to the age and abilities of the players!

boardgame.name: COMP/CON
boardgame.description:
Description from the itch.io page:
COMP/CON is a digital toolset for players and GMs of Massif Press' LANCER Tabletop RPG. It is currently under development, but is immediately useful for everyone who wants to play LANCER (or even just experiment with pilot and mech builds)

Includes:

Pilot builder and roster
Mech configuration builder
Multiple, saveable equipment configurations for pilots and frames
Export and share pilots and mechs
Automation of character math, stat tracking, and leveling up
Searchable, sortable item lists filtered by attributes and requirements
Printable generator for pilot and mech sheets (with an option for blank sheets)
Full item and license catalogues
NPC, Encounter, and Mission Builders
Pilot-side and GM-side Encounter runners

boardgame.name: Feywild Trial
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Journey to Barrenland, a Domain of Delight inspired by folk songs (Forró)

An inhospitable land where towering cacti forest provides shelter from the scorching sun.

Stubborn albeit altruistic fey gather in small communities to survive the arid and rugged terrain.

Defend yourself in a fey trial

Every year, the denizens of the Domain of Delight known as Barrenland gather in celebration.

Champions from the Archfeys that share the domain duel in various competitions.

The characters are expected to participate in such a celebration, but a vicious murder devolves into a trial that could have sour implications for the characters' stay in the feywild.

Fight a powerful fey

A trio of evil fey plan to dethrone the ruling Archfeys.

One of them plans to join the fey festivities to seed mistrust into the courts of the ruling Archfeys.

Only the adventurers might find about the evil fey's hidden agenda.

The Feywild: The Domain of Delight, Barrenland.

Barrenland is mostly a desert thorn forest. Its vegetation includes cacti, small thorny trees and occasional depressions that hold pockets of water.
The adversarial nature of the domain put the two Archfey the Black Hawk, Carcara, and the White Dove, Asa Branca, in eternal bickering!

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 4.

CONTENT ADVISORY: death (murder), abuse (manipulation)
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: The Grimm Reality
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A previously unknown relative needs your assistance at a family reunion to locate a missing
family member.
Kind of.
Oh, and it’s on another plane.

Enjoy a fun romp through a baker's dozen of Grimm's Fairy Tales in an attempt to rescue a relative that you never knew you had, with the assistance of a family you never knew you had!

Guidelines for using Hasbro's Candyland map as part of the adventure (which was done at the debut) is included for reference, but not a necessary component of the adventure.

This adventure debuted for play at UBCon XXXI in Buffalo, NY, on April 9th, 2022, as mentioned on the Big, Bad, Evil Game S1 E10 on Twitch and You Tube (thanks, Shawna and Matt!)

A Four-hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

CONTENT WARNING: child imprisonment, ritualized scarring (tattooing)
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Just Geomorphs #49
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Just Geomorphs bring more geomorphs to Dungeons in Blue! They include a mix of all corridor and room styles: 10-, 20- and 30-foot caverns and worked passages plus sewers and mines, all connecting an assortment of rooms, caves, chambers and caverns. Sets include GM and player versions of each geomorph, plus a map legend, one-third scale reference image, and a brief readme PDF.

boardgame.name: Just Geomorphs #50
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Just Geomorphs bring more geomorphs to Dungeons in Blue! They include a mix of all corridor and room styles: 10-, 20- and 30-foot caverns and worked passages plus sewers and mines, all connecting an assortment of rooms, caves, chambers and caverns. Sets include GM and player versions of each geomorph, plus a map legend, one-third scale reference image, and a brief readme PDF.

boardgame.name: Just Geomorphs #51
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Just Geomorphs bring more geomorphs to Dungeons in Blue! They include a mix of all corridor and room styles: 10-, 20- and 30-foot caverns and worked passages plus sewers and mines, all connecting an assortment of rooms, caves, chambers and caverns. Sets include GM and player versions of each geomorph, plus a map legend, one-third scale reference image, and a brief readme PDF.

boardgame.name: Just Geomorphs #52
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Just Geomorphs bring more geomorphs to Dungeons in Blue! They include a mix of all corridor and room styles: 10-, 20- and 30-foot caverns and worked passages plus sewers and mines, all connecting an assortment of rooms, caves, chambers and caverns. Sets include GM and player versions of each geomorph, plus a map legend, one-third scale reference image, and a brief readme PDF.

boardgame.name: Just Geomorphs #53
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Just Geomorphs bring more geomorphs to Dungeons in Blue! They include a mix of all corridor and room styles: 10-, 20- and 30-foot caverns and worked passages plus sewers and mines, all connecting an assortment of rooms, caves, chambers and caverns. Sets include GM and player versions of each geomorph, plus a map legend, one-third scale reference image, and a brief readme PDF.

boardgame.name: Mausoleum of the Seven
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Seven sarcophagi wait cracked in this circular mausoleum. The forest grows lush and wild outside it, while a river flows swiftly at the bottom of a nearby gorge.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving the Order of the Seven, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Pirate's Seaside Bunker
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Crystal-clear water laps against a timber pier. Up the shoreline waits a pirate’s fortress, armed with large cannons staring out into the bay. Inside it are rough-and-ready living quarters, with hammocks strung up about the place, as well as a few prison cells.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving a greedy merchant who might change the face of this coast forever, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Mangrove Swamp Fishing Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A village built on stilts above swamp water and coiling tree roots. A large hall filled with strange, magical artifacts make up its heart, whilst board walks connect all the houses.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring a wizard who sends magic stores cursed artifacts to see if they’re skilled enough to recognise if it’s cursed, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Phlegethon Ritual Site
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A rocky island with an altar of bones waits in the middle of a lake of boiling blood. Spirits writhe around in agony in the hot liquid, deep in the hells.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring the resurrection of the spirit of a dragon and a prophecy, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Textures 11
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Varied selection of metal floor textures.

boardgame.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 267 - May 2022)
boardgame.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 267
May 2022

Star Wars: Villainous - Power of the Dark Side

Issue has five variant covers

boardgame.name: Starfinder: Pirates of Skydock
boardgame.description:
You've got your crew, know the right folks, and even have a line on a potential financial backer who might grease the right palms to set you on the path to becoming a top-rate pirate. You're just missing one thing: a ship.

Lucky for you, you happen to know there's a top-of-the-line vessel with all the newest tech sitting in dock just waiting for an enterprising individual to take it out among the stars. Of course, if you know that, others do, too, and there can be only one captain. Will you become the newest pirate to set sail among the stars?

In Starfinder: Pirates of Skydock, players compete to be the one to successfully pull of one of the greatest heists of all time. Players take turns moving around the ship to complete objectives and gain the support they need to be recognized as the new captain. Over the course of the game, players build their characters to suit their style of play. When the ship launches, one of the players will emerge victorious — provided the ship doesn't go into lockdown first!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Firefly: Misbehavin'
boardgame.description:
Someone ever tries to kill you, you try to kill 'em right back!

In Firefly: Misbehavin', players get to control different factions of the Firefly 'Verse, from the criminal enterprises of Badger or Niska, to the self-righteous Alliance, and even Serenity as Mal attempts to find a crew and keep flyin'.

This deck-building card game gives each player a unique starting deck of cards, as well as access to characters, items, and locations in the Core, Border, and Rim. Compete to control your own corner of the 'Verse, or play through different episodes with a wide variety of objectives.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wayfinder (Issue 21 - May 2021)
boardgame.description: The first Wayfinder magazine for Pathfinder 2nd Edition.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Bard Muse of Tragedy: Power Through Sorrow
Dreams And Spirits: New Options For Oracles And Investigators
The Fashion of New Thassilon: Aromas of Eurythania and the Envy of Edasseril
Golarion Gazetteer: Nuat, the Breadbasket of Rahadoum
Golarion Gazetteer: The Green Lady's Creche: A Hidden Sanctuary in the Gravelands
Golarion Gazetteer: Vellumis: The Gray City
Heroes' Hoard: Items of the Sarkoris Scar
Phalanx, the Oprakian Game of Generals
Race for the Ettercap Crown: A Side-Trek Adventure
Rahlo And Jack's Wheels Of Cheese
Rebels of Cheliax: New Backgrounds for Chelaxian Players
Riffle Scrolls: Teaching New Casters Old Tricks
Side Trek Seeds: Age of Lost Omens
Skillful Items For The Foolhardy Discerning Professional
Sneaks And Peeks: Why You Should Use Secret Checks
The Tyrant's Phylactery: Theories and Musings
Weal or Woe: Legacies of the Goblinblood Wars
Weal Or Woe: The Cynic's Gambit
Weal or Woe: Two Sides of this Crusade

boardgame.name: Book of Crafts: Whispers of Dissent
boardgame.description:
Walking Secrets...

Once, I met a Chinese woman with hobbled feet and ancient eyes. Once, I fought a knight whose armor shone like burnished light. In the streets of Cairo, sharp-toothed men gnaw sinners' bones; in Haitian midnights, the Loa dance.

Not all magi go to war, my young friend. Many dwell in the Titans' shade, the shadows of shadows. These so-called "Orphans" have families, Son, and their ways may be more ancient than our own

Don't piss 'em off.

- Hapsburg, Orphan Seer

...Ageless Ways...
Those who see only the four sides of the Ascension Conflict ignore the "Crafts," Magickal societies that forsake Traditions and Technocracy for the Paths of their ancestors. Templars, voodoo priests, alchemists and modern Amazons are just a few of the nine groups detailed herein. What tales might they tell?

...Precious Truths.
The Book of Crafts: Whispers of Dissent presents eight magickal societies from the borders of the Ascension War, and includes:


Histories, beliefs, organizations and magicks for each Craft.
Templates, rotes and companion consors.
Intrigues and mysteries most Traditions never see.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Hunt A Killer: The Cosmic Adventure Of Supernova
boardgame.description:
After signing up for a membership to The Official Supernova Fan Club, you are contacted by Gunny Graham, the reclusive series creator. For over a decade, he has been unsuccessful at contacting his twin sister, Halo. He believes she’s still somewhere out there, alive, but in the clutches of The Void. He needs your help to find his sister before he loses her forever.

In this all-in-one box, you’ll receive evidence from Gunny Graham that will reveal the whereabouts of his sister.

Solve puzzles, examine clues, and decode mysterious dark symbols of The Void.

Translate the alien language, "Aquarian," pore over vintage documents, and sort through superhero merchandise to find Gunny’s twin sister.

Your choices matter! This game has two different endings, and you determine the outcome of the story.

Difficulty: 3/5 - Medium

Note: In order to play this game, you will need a Hunt a Killer account so they may send you an epilogue.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Hunt A Killer: 1973 Remastered
boardgame.description:
After the murder of their lead singer Darryl Fanton, FLUF became one of the most popular cult bands of the 1970’s. Although the police ruled it an open and shut case, there are still many unanswered questions and loose ends. 25 years after the murder, can you finally close the case of 1973? This box is packed with high quality items, easter eggs, and is one of the most intricate premium investigations that Hunt A Killer has to offer!

In this all-in-one box you will uncover the hidden story of a legendary rock group cut down in its prime by a gruesome murder.

Solve puzzles, examine clues, and decrypt ciphers to finally serve justice in this decades old cold-case.

This box includes an original album, a FLUF bandana, and other memorabilia that fully immerses you into the story. Each item relates to the overall mystery and it's up to you to find out how.

Difficulty: 4/5 - Medium

This is an updated/revised edition of Hunt a Killer: 1973. The main changes to gameplay include expanding one of the in-game websites and adding a new cipher to it, adding hints and tweaking some of the language found within the box’s clues for a more focused experience, and replacing the t-shirt with a new band poster.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Hunt A Killer: Fine Art Foul Play
boardgame.description:
A deductive reasoning mystery game that is great for players of any level! When the matriarch of a family of artists is found dead at the opening of her art exhibit, you must identify who within her circle is the killer. You must act fast though; her daughter has been accused of the crime and her trial is rapidly approaching!

In this all-in-one box you’ll take on the role of an experienced but out-of-practice private investigator and review clues to rule out suspects.

Rule out suspects based on their lack of means, motive, or opportunity. Review fingerprints, handwriting, lab reports, and deductive reason to progress the story to its thrilling conclusion.

Difficulty: 2/5

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Hunt A Killer: The Melancholy Killer
boardgame.description:
In this story by Peter Gillespie (America’s Most Wanted), a convicted serial killer mysteriously leaves you his belongings after being murdered in prison. Thousands of people believed he was innocent, and as protests erupt around the country, it is up to you to solve the mystery of the Melancholy Killer.

In this all-in-one box, you’ll examine the life of Edward Lee Dwyer and the prison riot that led to his death. Enjoy 5-7 hours of gameplay, no subscription required.

Solve puzzles, examine clues, and decrypt ciphers to unveil the truth about the coast-to-coast murders.

The Melancholy Killer’s personal briefcase will be delivered to your door. Examine official prison documents and other personal belongings from the hands of the serial killer.

Difficulty: 5/5 - Hard

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Strategic Mind: Spectre of Communism
boardgame.description: Strategic Mind: Spectre of Communism is a (hi)story-driven turn-based strategy set in the WW2 period. It offers refined wargame mechanics, story-rich gameplay, and modern 3D graphics. Lead the USSR Armed forces staging the world Communist revolution. For Stalin! For the Motherland!

boardgame.name: Hunt A Killer: Camp Calamity
boardgame.description:
When the staff of Camp Ashburne find a counselor’s charred remains in the embers of last night’s bonfire, the authorities are quick to rule it an unfortunate accident. However, one of the counselors discovers new evidence that suggests it was something much more sinister. Something dangerous is being cooked up at Camp Ashburne, and only you can solve this burning case! Do you have what it takes?

In this all-in-one box, you’ll review suspects’ statements and comb through evidence to determine the means, motives, and opportunities of each suspect.

Solve puzzles that will test your critical thinking, powers of deduction, and code cracking skills.

Use your cunning to unlock new evidence by discovering hidden messages that progress you through a gripping murder mystery where nothing is as it seems.

Difficulty: 4/5 - Medium

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Hunt A Killer: Ghastly Manor
boardgame.description:
Your expert team of ghost hunters has been called in to investigate an old inn that is being haunted by five ghosts. But this job may be more than what you bargained for and if you’re not careful you’ll be joining their ranks! Explore the manor, uncover their weaknesses, and banish them to the beyond!

In this all-in-one box, you will need to keep nerves and wits in order to survive the night.

You will have to channel your inner paranormal investigator. Find each ghost, discover what keeps them tethered to the physical plane, and answer their riddles to rid the manor of its infestation!

You will need to use items to interact with ghosts, decipher hidden codes, and make decisions that are life or death!

Difficulty: 1/5 - Easy

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering – Commander Legends
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering is the first-ever draftable Commander experience!

In the Commander format, players have a legendary creature who serves as the deck's commander. That creature is set aside at the start of the game, and can be cast as if it were in your hand. Normally, this is done with a 100-card singleton constructed deck. However, Commander Legends gives it a new twist. When drafting Commander Legends, each player opens a 20-card booster pack, selects two cards from it, and then passes the pack to the player sitting next to them. They then pick two more cards from the pack they've been handed, and so on, going around the table until all cards are picked. This is repeated with a second booster pack, and again with a third, until everyone has picked a total of 60 cards. Players then choose a commander (or a pair of commanders that both have the Partner ability) from among the cards they drafted, add any number of basic lands, and build a 60-card deck. Then everyone shuffles up their decks and battles in a free-for-all! (A larger pod of drafters splits into two groups first.)

The set is sold in draft boosters and collector boosters, and contains 361 cards (141 commons, 120 uncommons, 77 rares, and 22 mythic rares, plus the Prismatic Piper, a special helper card who appears more frequently than a common), plus a selection of 32 legendary reprints from past sets who appear with an all-new foil-etched treatment in collector boosters and, on rare occasion, in draft boosters as well. Two preconstructed Commander decks, "Arm for Battle" and "Reap the Tides," were also released alongside the main set.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Magic: The Gathering — Commander Legends: Battle for Baldur's Gate

boardgame.name: Combat of the 30: Chivalric Combat in 14th Century Brittany
boardgame.description:
Combat of the 30 pitches 2 players together in a small battlefield. Each player controls 30 knights, who have sworn to defeat the other side in order to win the bloody War of Breton Succession.

Each side is divided into 3 wings, which are activated and controlled in an innovative way in order to have as little downtime between turns.

Combat of the 30 melds historical wargaming with accessibility, and teaches players about this formative event in the history of European Chivalry.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Nay-Jay!: Expansion Pack!
boardgame.description:
Expansion for Nay-Jay! Extends the original game from four decks to six thereby allowing for six players. Aim is to get rid of all your cards by simultaneously placing cards on a number pile in numerical and colour order.

"Forget taking turns and playing it coll. This game is HOT HOT HOT! Flip your deck and flip your lid. Your friends and family will go wild! Nay-Jay is a rip-roarin' hootin' and hollerin' good time!

Each player races to play their own cards, building up and down on the shared number piles. Flipping cards, slapping cards and sometimes throwing cards, everyone competes to get their cards played first!

If you count to ten and back while doing the Hokey-Pokey, you can play Nay-Jay! If you can do all that while running from a ferocious tiger, you might win.
Get ready to play the fastest card game you'll ever lay your hands on. Nay-Jay is about to blow you away! - Designer blurb"

boardgame.name: Arch-hunt
boardgame.description:
Architecture is around us us, from our house to the museum we visited on our last trip. It is our daily environment.

It is not necessary to know architecture to consider certain buildings iconic: they are the ones that give identity to our cities. The aim of this game is to to get the best collection of this architectural icons... avoiding the obstacles put by the rest of the players!

Arch-hunt is an English contraction of "architecture-hunter". It is a game that aims to promote architecture by giving visibility to some of the most emblematic buildings of the 20th and 21st centuries. But its main purpose is to entertain during games in which resource management and strategy will be essential to win.

Each player represents an era through a famous architect. The goal of each player is to get as many points as possible by building the best collection of iconic buildings. To do this, each player must build 8 buildings using coins and cards from their hand. It is, therefore, a management and strategy game in which luck plays an important role. The game ends when a player manages to complete his collection, but this does not mean that he wins the game: the value of the buildings and the possible bonuses at the end of the game can make the difference.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Over the Top
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
An unwinnable game about life in the trenches.

On the Western Front of the Great War, you and your fellow soldiers squat in the muddy trenches, ducking to avoid artillery shells and hoping that the trench fever gets the other side before it gets you. Soon the order will come, and you’ll all go up, over the top, and into the waiting guns.

This GMless roleplaying game allows you to tell the stories of a squad of soldiers as they are forced to throw themselves against increasingly impossible odds.

boardgame.name: Talking Swords
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
In a world where humans cannot speak and swords can, talking swords are incredibly commonplace and are used to solve all conflicts, be they social or physical. As a result, talking swords are a requirement for all - not just adventurers - but are quickly abandoned if they fail to impress The One Who Wields Them...

Talking Swords is a one page RPG about talking swords and those that wield them. You play as a talking sword carried by a non-verbal adventurer and serve as both their weapon of choice and a diplomat, and must balance the two roles; go too far in one direction and your owner is sure to ditch you for a more balanced blade.

Suitable for as little as one player and a GM, Talking Swords is a great choice for a short, fun game or a long, epic fantasy adventure - just don't get too attached to your blade, The One That Wields Them certainly won't!

boardgame.name: Toumaï
boardgame.description:
In a race to the star, three magicians release their five birds towards the heart of the closest star to bring them back three magic wands that will turn the sky in their favorite color. The third wand will be the right one.

The first player to get 3 magic wands wins the game.

MOVES
Each player in turn (clockwise) plays one of their top-line pawns (the closest to the center of the star) ; the pieces make circular movements, clockwise or counterclockwise, to land on the top square of the line they just joined.

A bird of strength 1 must join the nearest line, either to its right or left.
A bird of strength 2 will join a line two tracks further to its right or left.
A bird of strength 3, will join a line three tracks further, to its right or left.
A magician has the choice between these 3 routes.


Empty tracks are not counted in the pawn’s moves. More the game evolve, more the empty spaces between the tracks are big.
A pawn can move alone, or take with it all or part of the pawns in its line, even if they are neutral or of the opponent's color ; the pawns taken along join the same line as their top pawn, behind it and in the same order.
The pawns of the "neutral color" can only move with the top pawns of the playing colors.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Jinns of the lake
boardgame.description:
On the fortieth day in the desert, a traveler discovers the Lake of Wishes. The Jinns of the Lake hire him as an architect to help them to build the Towers of Dreams. Whoever builds the most beautiful towers will win. A game of strategy where diplomacy and negotiation are used to support the spirit of conquest.

To earn the most points by building "Dream-towers" covered by your color (a Dream-tower has maximum 4 floors made of 1 pawn of each color).

Each player in turn moves a Dome-pawn of the color(s) they control, either to its right or its left, to stack on another Dome-pawn.

A Dome-pawn of strength 1 must be placed on the first free dome (alone or already stacked) to its right or its left.
A Dome-pawn of strength 2 must land on the second free dome (alone or already stacked) to its right or its left.
A Dome-pawn of strength 3 will necessarily land on the third free dome (alone or already stacked) to its right or its left.
A Dome-pawn of strength 4 will necessarily land on the fourth free dome (alone or already stacked) to its right or its left.


When moving, players may move their Dome-pawn alone, or with the entire tower, or only part of the tower they control on top.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Yoxii
boardgame.description:
To win at Yoxii, you must circle the Totem with your strongest pieces.

Each player in turn moves the Totem one square and places one of his/her pieces on the board. Be careful, you can jump over your pieces to go where the terrain is favorable to you.

A powerful abstract game, which mixes Chess and Go, but which looks like neither one nor the other. In this abstract and minimal universe, you will quickly learn how to find attack positions and how to defend yourself. Fun guaranteed.

Each player in turn moves the totem pole to a free square directly around it. The same player must then place one of his pieces around the new position of the totem. The pieces are divided into 4 values. O is worth 1 point, II is worth 2 points, Y is worth 3 points and X is worth 4 points. The player with the most points when the totem is completely surrounded wins the game. Note that players can skip their own pieces and move to where the terrain is favorable.

Anticipation is the key. In this game, everyone will find their own style, strength and tactics. The opening of the game is very strategic and the endgames are more combinatorial. Who will become the new world champion of this formidable abstract game?

boardgame.name: Teufelsbrücke
boardgame.description:
A bridge is built by 13 small open boxes distinguished by 4 colors. Dice rolls decide in which box and how many jungle animals you have to add to or to take from one box of the bridge. Play clockwise until the bridge collapses.

—user summary

Hilfe! Die Brücke schwankt - Wer bleibt cool und hat die ruhigste Hand?
Unten am Fluß lauern schon die Krokodile. Stürzt die Teufelsbrücke mit den Urwaldtieren ein, oder gibt's noch eine Rettung?
Reihum setzt ihr Urwaldtiere in die einzelnen Brückenteile. Dies geht so lange gut, bis die Brücke einstürzt. Wer es so geschickt anstellt, dass die Brücke erst beim nächsten Spieler einstürzt, gewinnt das Spiel.

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Rey de 12
boardgame.description:
Rey de 12 is a game in which you must play your cards well to be able to use their ability and in turn modify your dice so that in the final comparison it is not discarded and you can score, since both the cards and the dice are discarded if several players play the game. same card or the same face of the die, is played in an indeterminate number of rounds until a player manages to win two rounds. Will you manage to win the favor of the 12 kingdoms?

—user summary

boardgame.name: Master Dater: Big Love Edition
boardgame.description:
The Gamefound Exclusive Edition of Master Dater! You want it all and you can have it. Includes all Master Dater unlocks (like the Uncut expansion). The NSFW expansion (in its packaging), added cards, love letter, stickers, pins and other, upcoming, unlocks will come packaged inside the Big Love box.

CONTENTS
Rule sheet
95 Head Cards
95 Body Cards
217 “Interest” Cards
72 Flames
72 Sparks
73 Hearts
The Master Dater "Uncut" Expansion
Dating Hazzard: 10 Love-Themed Joking Hazard Cards

Also includes ALL Master Dater unlocks!

boardgame.name: Marching Order
boardgame.description:
Marching Order is a Solo/Co-op Dungeon delve that plays like Choose your own Adventure and Darkest Dungeon’s analog bastard child. You can play on your lonesome or bring some friends together to share in the hilarious misery. Buy your Rogues, put them in the dungeon, and start making some choices. Combat is done in a line- the sellsword can hit what's right in front of it, the archer can hit creatures 4 spaces away, etc. I wouldn't expect to stay where you are, however - the monsters have a way of shaking things up.

Get your coin, go back to the town of Rotbottom, and buy more gear. You only have so much room in your inventory and you need to make sure you have enough torches. Gamble some with your friends in Rotbottom's gambling halls or even pit yourself against the dice. Then do a little carousing on the carousing table and get to work on the next Delve.

There's coin to be won, Rogues.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Kriegs-Spiel, zur angenehmen Unterhaltung für Offiziere und gebildete Stände
boardgame.description:
Wargame played on a 75x99 cm game board with a square grid, each grid representing 200x200 paces of terrain of a hypothetical battlefield with generic blue and red armies. Played with approximately 75 cardboard square pieces representing 10 different types of military units and hundreds of smaller cardboard markers used for things like terrain that is demolished or on fire.

It was meant to be easier to learn and play in a shorter time than contemporary wargames, according to the rulebook.

Unlike most boardgames from this era this game was sold in a cardboard box with all components included. Game board was unmounted with instructions to glue it to thicker paper or cardboard. All game components were unpainted with included instructions what colors to paint board and pieces in.

boardgame.name: A&A Arnhem '44: Operation Market Garden
boardgame.description:
At Last – A&A Arnhem ’44 – Operation Market Garden!
This new series from cadet is called the Armies and Alliances series (A&A). The first in this series is no surprise – it’s “A&A Arnhem ’44.” With the familiar miniatures representing tanks, infantry, artillery, 88s, fighters, bombers, Airborne units and Waffen SS, this game is exactly what the community has been waiting for. 52 Action cards enhance the historical “storyboard” of the battle while a simple, yet realistic combat system means every decision and roll of the dice makes a difference. With a big, beautiful map created by Marc Von Martial and an easy-to-read large-print highly-illustrated rulebook, this game is ready to hit the table the minute you get the shrink wrap off!
The game has 114 minis and 52 game cards, plus the map is two big, bad 22x34 mounted sections that fold out and fit together for the ultimate Market-Garden experience. All segments of the campaign are included - from Eindhoven through "hell's highway" to Nijmegen and the dangerous route to Arnhem to cross the lower Rhine. The players get to re-fight the whole battle from the initial airborne drops to the final showdown between the II SS Panzer Corps and Allied XXX Corps. Supply, Air combat and ground attack, Drop Zones, Engineer, Air defense and Reinforcements are all included - along with leadership effects, historical events, and plenty of "easy" chrome built into the design via the event cards. It's only 10 simple turns and it plays quickly, but even the hardcore gaming enthusiast will discover a well-balanced challenge that is not to be taken for granted!
Can you capture the bridges along “Hell’s Highway” and hold them long enough for the XXX Corps to make it over the Rhine at Arnhem? Or will you dash the allied plans as the German player, slamming the door on the bold allied gamble? This one can go either way every time – history depends on YOU.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Miniature Book of Miniature Golf
boardgame.description: Dexterity game of minigolf in a form of a "book". Game is played used miniature golf club and a tiny golf ball. Game contains 9 fairways with varying themes. Player with least strokes at the end is the winner.

boardgame.name: nook
boardgame.description:
Oh no! The client hired too many interior designers to redecorate their nook! Try to win the client’s favor by quickly throwing down your own designs for how the nook should look.

Be the first player to empty your hand to win the round. Win 3 rounds to win the game and the title of Best Interior Decorator!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Lesser Magick
boardgame.description:
24 Cantrips for 5e

The well-oiled door swings open with ease, releasing a wave of incense and warm light onto the city streets. A smiling half-orc nods to you, his wide-brimmed hat casting a slight shadow across his face. Your apprentice robes rustle gentle as you make your way to the tomes and grimoires, each secured to their shelves by warded chains... save for one.

“Ah, I see you are a newly sworn practictioner who's a bit light on coin.” The half-orc says from your left. When did he-- "That small tome you see contains only lesser magicks. Cantrips, really. But for the price? They are the best value you can get for one such as yourself."

Lesser Magick is a collection of cantrip spells for use in your 5e role-playing games.

In this book you will find:


24 cantrips for the core cantrip-casting classes, each with their own hand-drawn arcane glyph.
A class-specific table of contents and a tag system for ease of reference
An average of 10 new cantrips for each class
More cantrips calling for uncommon saving throws
An emphasis on less common damage types
At least 2 cantrips per school of magic


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Murkrag's Bargain Bin
boardgame.description:
Murkrag’s Bargain Bin is a collection of magic items for use in your 5E role-playing games.

In this book, you will find 30 magic items of questionable quality. Perhaps they were failed experiments, prototypes, practical jokes, or student projects. Maybe not every enchanter is as competent as we’d like to believe, or possibly they set out to solve such a specific problem that the item they created seems preposterously useless out of context.

Whatever the reason for their creation, these aren’t your typical fare. You won’t find any flaming swords, wands of healing, or armors of cold resistance in this bargain bin. These items are all either quite limited, counter-intuitive, or otherwise just so very strange that you may wonder how they could ever be useful.

But perhaps with a little cleverness you, dear reader, will be the one to find a use for them, whether you’re a player or game master. After all, there is a certain thrill in finding the value of something others consider worthless. If that’s a thrill you wish to chase then please, take a look through Murkrag’s Bargain Bin.

- from the product page

boardgame.name: Murkrag's Compendium of Curios
boardgame.description:
Murkrag's Compendium of Curios: A Collection of 300 Magic Items for 5e

The well-oiled door swings open with ease, releasing a wave of incense and warm light onto the city streets. A smiling half-orc beckons to you, his wide-brimmed hat casting a slight shadow across his face.

“Welcome, traveler! Please, take a look at my collection, and let me know if anything catches your eye.”

Inside this compendium of over 190 pages, you'll find 300 illustrated magic items for 5e. Each entry includes a written description, rules text, and a collection of descriptor tags for an at-a-glance summary. From a club that turns into a chair to a staff that can turn fire spells into lightning spells and force the earth to rise up in your defense.

Designed as a drag-and-drop book for GMs, we've aimed to make it quick and simple to browse for the perfect item with a wide selection of rarity, power, and type. Included are weapons, armor, rings, ammunition, torches, spellcasting focuses, instruments, a deck of playing cards, and much more.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Murkrag's Compendium Cards: Armor
boardgame.description:
This deck of US Poker sized cards (2.5” x 3.5”) aims to help you easily reference the magic items you use most from our main title, Murkrag's Compendium of Curios. Inside you will find 81 cards featuring:


All 8 sets of light armor
All 21 sets of medium armor
All 8 sets of heavy armor
All 36 wearable accessories


All of which can be found in that book. Each card back features its beautiful sketch art by Aeledfyr. On the card face you will find most of the item’s details including notes on the item’s charges and recharge time, as well as the page number it's found in Murkrag's Compendium of Curios when there isn’t enough room on the card for everything the item does.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Murkrag's Compendium Cards: Foci
boardgame.description:
This deck of US Poker sized cards (2.5” x 3.5”) aims to help you easily reference the magic items you use most from our main title, Murkrag's Compendium of Curios. Inside you will find 103 cards featuring:


All 58 spellcaster foci
All 16 types of enchanted ammunition
All 17 wondrous items
All 12 miscellaneous tools


All of which can be found in that book. Each card back features its beautiful sketch art by Aeledfyr. On the card face you will find most of the item’s details including notes on the item’s charges and recharge time, as well as the page number it's found in Murkrag's Compendium of Curios when there isn’t enough room on the card for everything the item does.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Murkrag's Compendium Cards: Weapons
boardgame.description:
This deck of US Poker sized cards (2.5” x 3.5”) aims to help you easily reference the magic items you use most from our main title, Murkrag's Compendium of Curios. Inside you will find 116 cards featuring the simple and martial weapons found in that book. Each card back features its beautiful sketch art by Aeledfyr. On the card face you will find most of the item’s details including notes on the item’s charges and recharge time, as well as the page number it's found in Murkrag's Compendium of Curios when there isn’t enough room on the card for everything the item does.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Death Ride Normandy: Juno Beach
boardgame.description:
The Canadian 3rd Infantry Division, landing to the west of the 3rd British Infantry Division, made good gains on D-Day and looked like it would be able to advance on Caen on the 7th without problem. After consolidating for the night the Candians moved out smartly in the morning to the south along the road to Carpiquet Airport to the west of the city of Caen. Not long after starting out, and strung out in a long column, they came under intense and sustained fire from the 12SS Panzer Division. The fight between these 2 divisions would become legendary during the campaign and filled with vicious combat.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering — Innistrad: Double Feature
boardgame.description:
This special limited-edition booster expansion for Magic: The Gathering contains all the cards from Innistrad: Midnight Hunt and Innistrad: Crimson Vow in a unique black-and-white style.

Each booster pack of Innistrad: Double Feature contains 7 cards Midnight Hunt and 7 cards from Crimson Vow (4 commons, 2 uncommons, and 1 rare each), plus 1 card from either of the two sets in an all-new "Silver Screen" foil treatment that resembles the traditional foils seen in other sets, except that the sheen on them is silver instead of rainbow.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Magic: The Gathering – Innistrad: Crimson Vow
Magic: The Gathering – Innistrad: Midnight Hunt

boardgame.name: The High Magic Handbook
boardgame.description:
Created for Pathfinder 1st edition and the Spheres of Power system, witness the grand potential of magic unbridled! The high magic handbook offers options for Players and Game Masters to suffuse their settings with tremendous miracles, offering insights into the ways magic might sculpt the world.

Erect mighty spellzones that can permanently infuse a region with magic or unearth the secrets of mythic rituals and crafting! Harness magic’s new forms through the Universal Magic or dual-classing Gestalt options!

Push beyond 20th level with mighty new Epic Level rules or expand your magical reach through sphere-based Mass Combat abilities! The limitless avenues of the arcane are open to all who dream of them and the High Magic Handbook serves as your guide along these infinite paths.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Ultimate Spheres Cards: Weather
boardgame.description:
These Ultimate Spheres cards contain all of the talents for a particular sphere. Like spell cards, sphere cards let you build a handy deck of all of your character's powers, letting you mix, match, and keep track with ease!

This deck (74 cards) includes all Weather talents and advanced talents. Made for use with Ultimate Spheres of Power, for Pathfinder 1st edition.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: A game about quickly matching words to pictures but never words to words or pictures to pictures.
boardgame.description:
A realtime game where you match pictures with a word that describes that picture.

There are 4 objects and 3 colours. A red bed could be matched either with the word 'red' or the word 'bed'.

As soon as a match is made, the cards are taken and that will often reveal another math in a sort-of chain reaction!

Whoever takes the most cards wins the game.

—description from the designer
