This deck (103 cards) includes all Alteration talents and advanced talents. Made for use with Ultimate Spheres of Power, for Pathfinder 1st edition.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Coquina Keep of Clown-nihilation
boardgame.description:
An entry in the tenfootpole Wavestone Keep contest!

From the publishers blurb:

The CKC is a magical coquina stone tower that floats along the sea coast on a wide barge occasionally making land fall. Sometimes it will randomly teleport unexpectedly across the sea or inland, such as appearing in the street in front of the Cs favorite inn. It was made by yet another mad wizard known as the Keepmaster for no particular purpose by to terrorize coastal communities with an invasion of lizard folk clowns when it washes ashore.

boardgame.name: Dragonbowl
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dragonbowl is a setting and pulp action adventure in one. It plunges a party into a rich festival scenario that revolves around a deadly gladiatorial contest, where the dangers they face in the arena are almost secondary to those they encounter in the murky criminal underworld they find themselves in: a world that stinks of corruption, human trafficking, illegal dinosaur-trading, necromancy, blood sacrifice and unnatural arcane experiments.

The action takes place in a vast cavern in Mount Waterdeep, known as the Underbelly, where not only Dragonbowl Arena, but also an entire festival grounds – consisting of temples, bars, casinos, funfairs and markets - has been constructed to host this grand sporting extravaganza.

With Xanathar, Jarlaxle, Davil, Volo and the Black Viper all in attendance, and scores of 'entanglements' (faction missions) to keep players busy, Dragonbowl can be played as a sequel to Waterdeep: Dragon Heist, or as a first step towards the Undermountain and the Dungeon of the Mad Mage. Equally, it can be played as a stand alone adventure, or easily transported into other settings.

boardgame.name: This is What You Have Come For
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Old Gods of Appalachia Roleplaying Game is a tabletop roleplaying game set in an Alternate Appalachia that explores the Green, the Inner Dark, and things even more ancient. It is based on the Old Gods of Appalachia podcast, a captivating eldritch horror anthology created by Steve Shell and Cam Collins, and the winner of the 2021 Discover Pods Best Overall Podcast and Best Audio Drama or Fiction Podcast awards.
boardgame.rpg: Old Gods of Ɐppalachia Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Scene Deck
boardgame.description:
The Lighthearted Scene Deck is a 53-card deck designed to help provide story and narrative prompts in your games of Lighthearted! Each card pairs an 80s song with a 2-3 line prompt for a new scene that you can use to help fill out downtime, plan out sessions, or draw inspiration from when you’re not sure what should happen next.

52 cards contain prompts, and there is 1 instruction card.

You will need LIGHTHEARTED to use this deck.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Eorathril Character Sheet
boardgame.description:
A character sheet for Gallant Knight Games' fantasy OSR: Eorathril.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Barrow of the Corpse Crawler
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Pit your roleplaying group against a ravenous Corpse Crawler with this Epic Encounters boss box! Compatible with fifth edition or any fantasy roleplaying game.

There are things in the endless passages beneath the world; things that feast on the dead. Things that carry death with them, spewing foulness in their wake as they drag their vast bulk through an endless darkness. The corpse crawler. An enormous worm, oozing through the illimitable darkness, drawn ineluctably by the scent of the dead. And who knew death had undone so many?

Little is truly known of the gluttonous worms, for few scholars possess the appetite to descend into the endless network of tunnels to study them…

In times of peace and plenty, Corpse Crawlers remain few and small. But where there is death, there is worm food, and feed the Corpse Crawler does. Some scholars believe one is approaching a size beyond which it might become unkillable. Is it even possible to kill a beast of such implausible vastness? I guess you’ll find out.

Inside this boss box is everything you need to challenge a Corpse Crawler, including a large, highly detailed Corpse Crawler miniature (100mm base!) and an adventure book woven with information to fuel your imagination. It’s up to you to discover which rumours and whispers are true!

Can you overcome this gluttonous abomination, or will you end up as worm food? Use Barrow of the Corpse Crawler as a standalone encounter or as part of a new or existing RPG campaign.

boardgame.name: Hive of the Ghoul-Kin
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Confront formidable, flesh-eating foes with this Epic Encounters warband box!

Ghouls teem in the darkness, stealing up from their subterranean kingdom to filch corpses wherever they can find them. There’s not an undisturbed graveyard to be found on the continent.

The most wealthy, and most determined not to be molested in their eternal sleep, invest in steel caskets. Even this does not stop the ghouls for long — how could it? Their brood-sire simply breeds a ghoul with claws capable of shearing through steel. If you take the words of a bizarre book seriously, of course. But such a thing would explain much about the ghouls…

Didn’t you ever wonder why so many dead are taken from their graves? True, it’s easier to pretend otherwise. But the thefts are getting more frequent, and more noticeable. And now, the living are being taken down into the hive. Of course, they’re no longer living by the time they get there. Do you dare venture into a terrifying subterranean realm to confront the ghoul-kin?

Inside this warband box is everything you need to challenge the ghoul-kin, including 15 highly detailed minis and an adventure book woven with information to fuel your imagination.

Can you survive the hive? Use Hive of the Ghoul-kin as a standalone encounter or as part of a new or existing RPG campaign!

boardgame.name: One Moment
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

ONE MOMENT
Or, a Historical Record of the Unforgotten Realms

They say everything happens for a reason.

But when a patch of bad time sends you to a nearby Domain of Delight in the Feywild, it’s up to you to modulate this archfey’s Momentum before history itself is set permanently out of joint.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters (Optimized for APL8)

(Content Warning: bullying, coerced behavior, existentialism, immolation, social anxiety)
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Torchlit Adventures Spell Cards
boardgame.description:
This product contains all the spells found in the Torchlit Adventures rulebook on handy reference cards.

It does require the Torchlit Adventures book to use.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Torchlit Adventures Player Reference Cards
boardgame.description:
This product contains 76 reference cards for the following rules in Torchlit Adventures:


Weapon Qualities
Journey Roles
Camping Tasks
Light


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Darkness Tilt Cards
boardgame.description:
Tilts are a unified way of applying circumstances to both characters and scenes during violent encounters. Tilts are mechanically similar to Conditions, but they affect characters and scenes in combat only. Outside combat, use Conditions instead.

Tilts do not give players Beats when they end, but the effects of a Tilt can easily cause a Condition. For instance, a character in a fight gets a handful of road salt flung into his
eyes and receives the Blinded Tilt. When combat ends, this shifts to the Blind Condition.

These Tilt Cards are a handy and elegant way to keep track of and incorporate Tilts into your Chronicle with each of the 21 cards featuring a single Tilt.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Dyson's Book of Swords
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dyson's Book of Swords is a compilation of the #Swordtember and #Choptober entries posted on the Dyson Logos blog in September and October 2021. Here all 50 swords are presented with a full page illustration of each sword along with a description of the sword's magical properties on the facing page.

The sword descriptions are rules light, making them suitable for use in any edition of The World's Most Popular Fantasy Roleplaying Game from B/X through to 5th Edition. They are also perfect for use in retroclone and reskinned versions of the game.

boardgame.name: Dragon Braggarts
boardgame.description:
"So, Commander, you hear about that whopper of a dragon over in Norwich area? They say he's a real monster."
"Yeah, so what if he is?"
"Bet 7 of my knights could take care of him. They're good lads."
"Hah! 7 of your knights? I'd only need 3 of mine! Well... 4 if one of 'em is Sir Smarty-pants over there."
"4 knights?! That's impossible! I'd like to see you try!"
"You want me to prove it? All right, men! Suit up! We're off to Norwich!"

In Dragon Braggarts, players guess how many knights they need to defeat the dragon, scoring points if they are correct. However, only the biggest braggart (or rather the player who needs the fewest knights to successfully defeat the dragon) will be the one to snag the points. Using their cunning, estimation, and good old-fashioned luck, one player will earn the title of Grand Dragon Master!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Heroes & Wizards
boardgame.description:
Heroes & Wizards is a light-hearted and party-ready card game where players race to collect a winning combination of legendary heroes in order to embark on an epic quest to save the game's kingdom from impending doom.

Players can steal hero cards, enlist the help of powerful wizard cards and play mischief-making event cards as they prepare their party of heroes for adventure. To launch a quest and win the game, a player's party must first acquire heroes with enough compatible skills between them, then the player must get their hands on an elusive quest card in order to lock down victory before their opponents get the chance.

Heroes and Wizards gives a light-hearted and family-friendly twist to the fantasy role-playing game genre, but its interactive gameplay leaves plenty of room for tense competition and treachery too, to suit both skilled strategists as well as first-time gamers.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Cavaliers of Mars Talent and Path Cards
boardgame.description:
Return now to dying Mars in its last age of glory. A planet of flashing swords and choking sands, of winking courtesans and lantern-lit canal cities. Mars, where fortune and death are two sides of the same obsidian chit, where lost cities and dry oceans stretch between the last bastions of civilization.

These Cavaliers of Mars Talent and Path Cards enhance the systems found in the Cavaliers of Mars Core Rulebook, making referencing rules quicker for play.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Adventure Ref
boardgame.description: Definitions, grammar fuel random tables, top books, movites, TV shows, and video games

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Elf Ref - Races of Amoverek
boardgame.description: Elvish language dictionary, parallel open gaming systems, definitions, grammar fuel random tables, top books, movies, TV shows, and video games

boardgame.name: Minimalist Descriptive Civilization
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Minimalist Descriptive Civilization generator is created for most human civilizations to help inspire a brief description.

The party is approaching a the party is approaching a region.

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #12)
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the ThunderZine, the support 'zine for all of Kyoudai Games brands, including the Infinity's Edge Role-Playing Game, the Tiny Legacies line of sourcebooks for Tiny Supers, and Thunderscape in all its many forms!

The ThunderZine is developed for and with the members of the Kyoudai Games Patreon, who get it several months in advance of the public and who have the opportunity to contribute ideas and requests for specific content.

boardgame.name: Just Geomorphs #54
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility.

boardgame.name: They Came From Beneath the Sea! Quips and Cinematics Cards
boardgame.description:
They Came from Beneath the Sea! is a dramatic and farcical tabletop roleplaying game encompassing the wonder, horror, thrills, and humor of 1950s and 1960s science fiction. This game allows you to play with all the great content from the B-movies of decades ago, and promises a dynamic, fun time for all involved!

They Came From Beneath the Sea! Quips and Cinematics Cards include more than 120 cards featuring perfect phrases and one-liners to drop in during key moments of play, as well as Cinematic metagame abilities.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: They Came From Beneath the Sea!

boardgame.name: Cypher System XP Deck
boardgame.description:
In the Cypher System, exploration and risk are everything. Players earn experience points not for killing monsters, but for making discoveries and facing unexpected challenges. You might rack up your XP between sessions, but most commonly you receive experience points during play, when events take an unexpected turn or you make a remarkable discovery. And XPs are useful in both the short- and long-term: spend 1 XP to reroll for yourself (or a friend), or save them up for character advancement!

The Cypher System XP Deck gives you a set of tangible tokens to represent experience points. This 30-card deck is a simple but useful tool at the game table.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: NPC Deck
boardgame.description:
Putting together a new adventure or campaign? GMing an impromptu encounter? Got a game session that’s gone in an entirely unexpected direction? In almost any gamemastering situation, one of the greatest challenges is coming up with nonplayer characters (NPCs) that are interesting, unique, and fleshed out—particularly when time is short. The 100-card NPC Deck helps you breathe life into your NPCs with details of their appearance, personality, abilities, and possessions—even their names.

Just create a role to fill—shopkeeper, mobster, duke’s seneschal, street urchin, ship captain—and assign the NPC a level. Then use this deck to fill in details and inspire you in one of three ways:


Draw or choose a card and use it as-is. Each card gives you a first and last name (as well as a fantasy name alternative); details of appearance, demeanor, and personality; modifications to the NPC’s level; and a distinguishing feature or item. The deck includes 100 distinctive ready-to-use NPCs for a vast variety of roles.
Draw several cards and mix and match elements. There are millions of possible combinations!
Draw or choose a card, and tailor your NPC as needed with your own ideas. Grab a card and alter the appearance, demeanor, personality, or modifications to make it your own.


Best of all, the NPC Deck is setting-neutral—even game-system-neutral! The details provided will work in virtually any campaign setting.

Stop struggling to breathe life into your NPCs, and never get caught flat-footed for a character’s name or details again. Get the NPC Deck!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Last Call of the Ancients
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Last Call of the Ancients is Part 5 of the 6-Part "Chronicles of Keranow".

It is for 13th PCs and should take them to 17th level at its conclusion.

The campaign is set Duchy of Keranow. The Duchy itself is inspired by myths of the British Isles, The Norse Lands and France. It seeks to lightly draw in elements from Historic Cornish, Arthurian, Celt and Viking legends.

Armed now with the Lost Swords Of Power, the brave Knights of Keranow face enormous Wyrms from the ocean depths, and even such mighty heroes may fear these terrors from the sea.

boardgame.name: Lost Swords of Power
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lost Swords of Power is Part 4 of the 6-Part "Chronicles of Keranow".

It is for 10th PCs and should take them to 13th level at its conclusion.

The campaign is set Duchy of Keranow. The Duchy itself is inspired by myths of the British Isles, The Norse Lands and France. It seeks to lightly draw in elements from Historic Cornish, Arthurian, Celt and Viking legends.

Having survived the bizarre mirror-world of the Fae, rumours are rife of the return of dragons to the land. The scramble is on to find how and why they have returned. A search for ancient weapons begins in case the dragons have a malicious intent. This means a trip to the mysterious island of Lyonesse.

boardgame.name: Lament for the Elf Princess
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lament for the Elf Princess is Part 3 of the 6-Part "Chronicles of Keranow".

It is for 7th PCs and should take them to 10th level at its conclusion.

The campaign is set Duchy of Keranow. The Duchy itself is inspired by myths of the British Isles, The Norse Lands and France. It seeks to lightly draw in elements from Historic Cornish, Arthurian, Celt and Viking legends.

The heroes of Keranow are invited to the Grand Marriage of the Princess of the Ker elves and the Duke of Tamarin’s youngest son.

boardgame.name: The Cruellest Mistress of All (PF1)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cruellest Mistress of All is an adventure module for 4th level PCs. It is the sequel to The Last Prayer of the Dying.

This is part 2 of a much larger campaign set in the Duchy of Keranow. The Duchy itself is inspired by myths of the British Isles, The Norse Lands and France. It seeks to lightly draw in elements from Historic Cornish, Arthurian, Celt and Viking legends.

This module was kickstarted in spring of 2016.

boardgame.name: The Cruellest Mistress of All (OSR)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cruellest Mistress of All is an adventure module for 4th level PCs. It is the sequel to The Last Prayer of the Dying.

This is part 2 of a much larger campaign set in the Duchy of Keranow. The Duchy itself is inspired by myths of the British Isles, The Norse Lands and France. It seeks to lightly draw in elements from Historic Cornish, Arthurian, Celt and Viking legends.

This module was kickstarted in spring of 2016.

boardgame.name: The Last Prayer of the Dying (PF1)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For 1st level PCs

This module was kickstarted in autumn/winter of 2015

Module Synopsis The party are travelling to the new frontier to help return an ancient Duchy to its former glory. A chance encounter with the legendary 'Arisen Knight', a very old hero, sets them on a path to adventure. Like most published scenarios there are some railroad parts, but enough choice to provide the feel of a sandbox.

boardgame.name: The Last Prayer of the Dying (OSR)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For 1st level PCs

This module was kickstarted in autumn/winter of 2015

Module Synopsis The party are travelling to the new frontier to help return an ancient Duchy to its former glory. A chance encounter with the legendary 'Arisen Knight', a very old hero, sets them on a path to adventure. Like most published scenarios there are some railroad parts, but enough choice to provide the feel of a sandbox.

boardgame.name: 2000's A Decade of Trivia
boardgame.description: 2000s A Decade of Trivia is a turn of the century game! A fun card game to play at a BBQ, take to the beach, or on game night with friends. You'll enjoy this sweet deck of trivia fit for millennials and more.

boardgame.name: Digital Transformation Card Game
boardgame.description:
The aim of the Digital Transformation Card Game is to offer an entertaining and easily accessible way to learn about the many aspects of digital transformation, its underlying drivers of change, methods and technologies connected with that change and particularly the many ways to combine any of these into a winning strategy.

Feel free to use the cards in any way you desire:
For example try to play your favorite card game with the digital transformation set of cards, e.g. Poker, or develop new rules to create your very own game. At the back of the pack you will find rule-sets for Digital Power Black Jack, Go Fish Digital Powers!, Digital Memory, Digital Moving Puzzle and a suggestion how to use it in a consultancy setting.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Three Sisters: Extra Pads
boardgame.description:
Running low on score sheets? Pick up an extra set of pads to keep on rolling and farming!
One set of both pads, these are the exact same, size, and quantity found in the game box.

boardgame.name: Dies Irae
boardgame.description:
From the Back of the book:
Dies Irae è un gioco di sopravvivenza e avventura ambientato durante una terribile apocalisse medievale, uno scenario di ucronico orrore in cui i Morti ritornano dai loro sepolcri e hanno una fame incessante di carne umana.

English translation:
Dies Irae is a survival and adventure RPG set during a terrible medieval apocalypse, a scenario of uchronic horror in which the Dead return from their graves with an incessant hunger for human flesh.

boardgame.name: Multiverse Ballad
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:
Multiverse Ballad è un viaggio tra infiniti mondi che propone 14 archetipi del Multiverso, personalizzati con decine di aspetti e talenti unici. Un lungo arco narrativo vi condurrà attraverso mille trame tese da un solo ordito.

English translation:
Multiverse Ballad is a journey through infinite worlds that offers 14 archetypes of the Multiverse, customized with dozens of unique aspects and talents. A long narrative arc will lead you through a thousand plots stretched by a single warp.

boardgame.name: Color Strike
boardgame.description:
You steal good Cards, give away bad cards like lightning and you never confess color.

Build a secret straigth of 6 cards in the right color order by thinking tactically and quickly.
With the highest score in your street, you are the king or queen of Color Strike!

Gameplay:
6 Cards are placed in a circle on the table, 1 of each color.
1 card is placed in the middle of the circle, the color of that card shows what cards you are allowed to play (the card colors next to the same colour card in the circle)

Depending on the type of card you play, it can have some effects:
- Number cards: Nothing happens
- # cards: steel a card from another player en give him one card you don't want.
- Strike Cards: You MAY Place a card on the table to build your straigth, if you place a card, all other players MUST place a card on the table. If you don't, nobody does.

Thez cards should be in the same (color) order as the cards in the circle.

The game ends when each player has 6 cards on the table, you receive points for the longest straigth and #cards.

boardgame.name: Nocturnally
boardgame.description:
It is night in the forest. It is so dark that the young night animals cannot find their parents! Together with Firefly and Glowworm we will help them out. Can we reunite all the night animals before the sun rises?

Nocturnally is an exciting and challenging variation on the well known Memory game. The players help each other to remember the cards. Several levels of play guarantee many joyful hours!

boardgame.name: Crimibox: Dossier Oorlog
boardgame.description:
With the arrival of an enigmatic diary, panic erupts at the C.R.I.M. headquarters. The diary turns out to be old and comes from an ominous period in history. It was the key to untold horror many years ago. Can you bury the hatchet before the blood-curdling past repeats itself?

Dive into the mystery and uncover the shadowy past. Play your cards right and you may single-handedly avoid the bloody future that awaits.

Solve your own murder mystery. With the help of a chat bot you investigate police files, photo's and evidence. Search the internet and use social media to unravel the secrets of your suspects.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Colossus & Magik
boardgame.description:
Born in Siberia, Piotr Rasputin is a mutant with a skin of steel and a heart of gold. He can transform his entire body into organic metal, granting him superhuman strength, durability, and stamina. Colossus is a gentle giant, however. He is sometimes reluctant to use his physical strength in combat, feeling a responsibility to use his powers to improve the lives of mutants and humankind.

Illyana Rasputin is the younger sister of Colossus. Abducted at a young age by Belasco, the sorcerer and master of the realm known as The Otherplace, Illyana trained in the art of magic and overthrew her captor to become Magik, the Sorceress Supreme of Otherplace! Her mutant ability to teleport herself and others through space and time by using stepping discs, pieces of Limbo that act as a midway point between locations and points in time, allows her to be anywhere and anywhen her mystic power is needed.

This pack gives players the chance to round out their X-Men teams with these powerful characters, beginning with beautifully-detailed, dynamic Colossus and Magik miniatures for them to paint and customize. Already featuring a combination of powerful mutant and mystical abilities, players can unlock even more power from this pair with three Team Tactic cards that allow them to tap into the power of Limbo or throw Wolverine with the famous Fastball Special.

boardgame.name: Beau Séjour
boardgame.description:
After the discovery of a murder, it's up to a restless ghost and a few brave seers to unravel the mystery. But that could get tricky...

One of you is responsible for this heinous crime and will do everything in his power to go free.

As a seer or ghost, can you find answers to all the dark questions surrounding this murder? Or will you, as a killer confuse the group so they will never find out the horrifying truth?

boardgame.name: Lista rätt!
boardgame.description:
In this trivia game the players are asked to rank a "top 5" list out of 10 possible answers.

An innovative trivia game that's fun to play with your family and friends.

Lista rätt! is a trivia game with a game-changing idea. Each player is asked to write down a "top 5" list. One question could look something like "Rank the animals' weight" with the 10 possible answers being Elephant, Lion, Rhino, Rabbit, Fox, Coyote, Giraffe, Squirrel, Shark and Butterfly.
At the same time, you have to be a bit tactical hence a wrong answer deducts points from your tally.

boardgame.name: Numenera Ruin Deck
boardgame.description:
The Numenera Ruin Mapping Engine is one of the most popular features of Jade Colossus: Ruins of the Prior World, the essential GM’s companion for adventure building in the weird and wondrous Ninth World. The 100-card Ruin Deck builds on this feature, letting you quickly and easily generate ruins as you prep for your game, or create them on the fly as you play. Use it in conjunction wth the Numenera Ruin Mapping Engine, or complely on its own.

Draw a card as you create a room, obstacle, location, or encounter. Each card gives you:


Two prompts for the weird prior-world contents of the room or space. Pick your favorite, or combine them into something really strange.
A random encounter with a Ninth World creature, drawing from Numenera Discovery, Numenera Destiny, the Ninth World Bestiary, and the Ninth World Bestiary 2.
The number of exits from the room, and their directions.
A random color for some aspect of the room—a red energy discharge, blue synth, green beasts, and so on.
A random number between 1-100, the equivalent of rolling percentile dice, to quickly generate results from random cypher, encounter, or Numenera Ruin Mapping Engine tables.


Whether you’re carefully planning your next game session, or need to throw together some quick encounters on the fly, the Ruin Deck makes the GM’s job easier with creative prompts for your imagination and time-saving features.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Therapy
boardgame.description:
A daily dose of Therapy is recommended. Possible side effects; unexpected truths combined with a high risk of bursting into laughter. In this game, players take turns to move their sofa across the playing board in the hunt for mental balance.
Through conversations with the coach, the group therapy and knowledge about yourself and your co-players, you'll get rid of your worries and obsessions.

Dive into your personal reflections. You'll be amazed how people think about - VERY - ordinary things.

The player who answers the questions correctly and can judge him/herself, aswell as his/her co-players, the best wins. The game has been designed by two psychologists and a writer.

boardgame.name: Beast the Primordial Condition Cards
boardgame.description:
Part of the Beast: the Primordial rules, Conditions add an additional layer of consequence and reward to certain actions in the Chronicles of Darkness. Various things within the course of a game can cause Conditions. These include exceptional successes, supernatural abilities, and really any situation where the Storyteller thinks they can be used to heighten the drama of a game.

These Beast: the Primordial Condition Cards are a handy way to keep track of and incorporate Conditions into your Chronicle with each of the 36 cards featuring a single Condition.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Dino Draw 'n Dodge
boardgame.description:
The meteors are showering down! as a velociraptor or Raptorex, you are in charge of rescuing the dinosaur population from extinction by collecting as many eggs as you can... but there are other dinosaurs out there trying to steal and eat eggs, and some nasty Apex predators out to get you too! Do you have what it takes to collect the most eggs and fend off the competition?

Avoid meteors, defeat dinosaurs, and collect eggs in an always changing map system where the routes and challenges are never the same!

The person with the highest score at the end of the game is the winner!

Playing solo? try and beat your own personal best!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Long Shot: The Dice Game – Horse Set Mini Expansion
boardgame.description: Set of horses that comes with the Barnes and Noble version of the game. This Set of horses focuses if the jockey actions and has a symbol of a jockey.

boardgame.name: Borikén: The Taíno Resistance
boardgame.description:
Borikén — that is, modern-day Puerto Rico — is now home to a people that proudly trace their heritage back to its Taíno, African, and Spanish roots. These three different cultures were brought together by some of the worst measures of the human condition — greed, slavery, and genocide — but the result is a vibrant culture, rich with history and traditions, and known for its beauty and passion.

The Taíno people are gone, but they live on through the people who are trying to connect the broken pieces of their culture almost five hundred years later. To that end, this game tells the story of Borikén through the eyes of the Taíno people, a people who existed and faced their own challenges even before the Spanish arrived on their shores (pre-1493), who rallied together to try to rid their home of the overwhelming invaders (1493-1512), and in failing to do so had to make hard sacrifices so that a few might survive (1512-1529).

In designing and developing Borikén: The Taíno Resistance, we decided that in an effort to convey a holistic picture of the Taíno people, no part of their story could be left out, so the campaign game combines three unique scenarios, each covering one of the three eras of Taíno history, focusing on the type of conflict in which the Taíno people were engaged.

These three game scenarios can be played individually as standalone games or played as a three-part campaign in which the end state of each game serves as the set up for the next. Each game scenario accommodates 2-4 players and takes between 45-90 minutes to play.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

boardgame.name: Scarred Lands Spell Cards 2: Yugman's Guide
boardgame.description:
Pay Heed to the Wisdom of Yugman the Sage

A century and a half after the Divine War, the titans lay defeated and scattered across Scarn and beyond. As the people of Ghelspad work to build a new world on the war-torn remnants of a fallen paradise, new heroes rise, and new threats emerge. Yugman the Sage brings an overview of these new heroes and villains, as well as the tools they use to rise to power.

Scarred Lands Spell Cards

Whether you are a player or a GM, you can enhance your Scarred Lands game with this set of spell cards! Every spell from Yugman's Guide to Ghelspad is included in this deck of cards. Lay them out next to your sheet during play for quick, easy reference to all your character’s Scarred Lands spells.

boardgame.name: Men of the West
boardgame.description:
The timeless appeal of the legends of the Hero Wars has resulted in an enduring interest in the period.

Surviving texts, supplemented by archaeological evidence, are used here as the basis of this reconstruction of the combatants of the initial phases of that world-shattering conflict.

This volume is a companion to The Armies and Enemies of Dragon Pass.

Many mercenaries and adventurers from the West have been drawn to the conflict in Dragon Pass. Their homelands of Seshnela, Fronela, and Ralios are also fighting their own Hero Wars.

Seshnela strives to impose the ambition of One God, One King, One Empire on the divided city-states and kingdoms of Ralios, where many look to the long-prophesied return of the hero Arkat for their salvation. In Fronela the idealists of Loskalm must confront the bloodthirsty armies of the Kingdom of War raging across the land bringing destruction and death. And there are yet more threats and perils.

This book presents details of the warriors, soldiers and mercenaries fighting during opening periods of the Hero Wars, their arms and armor, their ships, their cultures, histories and organization, terrain, the battlefields on which they fought, their fortifications, their magic, and their religions.

Army Lists provide details of some of the regiments which fought in these epic conflicts, supplemented by numerous illustrations of the participants.

Warning: adult themes - some aspects of Bronze Age warfare may be distressing. There is also a description of Gloranthan sorcery.

Note: The Armies and Enemies of Dragon Pass provides details of arms and armor, formations and many other things useful to the reader.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Two Lodges
boardgame.description:
The Freemason master Peyton Randolph has been murdered. A valuable map leading to a lost Viking artifact has been lost. Its whereabouts could tip the balance toward a young nation seeking to throw off the British yoke.

Following Peyton’s death, the Freemason lodges have since splintered. Nevertheless, both seek the map, and it won’t be long until they close in on the artifact.

Notable revolutionary Thomas Jefferson knows that the rebels must find the treasure first. His shadow operatives have been sent to ensure they find the map first.

The Two Lodges is a feature-length campaign for FLAMES OF FREEDOM, taking players from the Commonwealth of Virginia to the shores of Rhode Island in a race against time to find the lost treasure.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Night of the Vivimancer
boardgame.description:
The small town of Dellburg is a trading stop, a waystation upon the Imperial Highway. People stop here, they have a drink, they take a load off. The Town's most notable feature is that there is running water and sewer sanitation, unheard of for a town of this size in the middle of nowhere. Dellburg though, is hiding a deep dark secret. Under the town is a Warren of Skrzzak, the ratmen that most people will tell you are not real.

In fact, they are deadly real and what happens below is about to spill out to the land above.

Night of the Vivimancer is an adventure for Zweihander Grim and Perilous RPG designed for a party of 4-5 Characters at the end of their Basic Tier. The adventure should take 3-5 sessions to finish, and can be played on it's own or dropped into a currently running game.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Ancient Magick
boardgame.description:
Ancient Magick
Alternative Magick Expansion

Enhance the Magick experience at your table with a multitude of new and adapted game features.

Explore the long forgotten tradition of Cabal Magick.

Chose from four new regular Professions to begin your adventures as a practitioner of either the ancient Cabal Magick or the obscure Covenant Magick.

Advance towards a new Expert Profession.

Change the dynamic of combat with a new Special Action and six new Magickal Reactions.

Discover the Cabal of Pragmatism with 22 distinct Paths.

Learn a total of 22 new Petty spells and 22 new Lesser spells.

Enhance the drama of battle by utilising 18 Reaction spells.

Research a new Ritual.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Leather, Steel, Blade & Bone
boardgame.description:
Add more gory detail to your grim & perilous games with Leather, Steel, Blade & Bone.

This supplement contains:


Separate injury tables – including Moderate, Serious and Grievous tables for each body part per weapon type
Includes details such as arrow impaled from wrist to elbow and movement penalties for Injuries to the legs
15 new combat-orientated Drawbacks to challenge veteran combatants, such as Frequent Seizures, Restless Sleep and Uncontrolled Retching
Fully detailed rules for using piecemeal armor, to include; Qualities, Encumbrance, hit locations, armor damage and a revised Damage Threshold chart
Simple charts for upgrading piecemeal armor for opponents


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The In Between
boardgame.description:
THE IN BETWEEN is a horror game for ZWEIHÄNDER GRIM & PERILOUS RPG. The Party has been cast into a shadow realm between life and death, where they are being followed by a shadowy figure, while at the same time something darker, more primal is hunting them.

Pushing through the shadows and visions of the past the Party will confront the horrors that happened in the would of the living and their rippling shadows that were transported to this netherworld. Eventurally they will confront the mistress of this place, a necromancer of unspeakable power and evil.

THE IN BETWEEN is geared towards Characters who are in the middle of their Basic Tier of play and assumes that the Party is already formed and that they have been on a few adventures together already. It should take about 8-10 game sessions, or 16-20 hours to play through the adventure as written.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Exhaust
boardgame.description:
Exhaust is a game of one elimination. One player is eliminated and the other players win.

In this game, each player is dealt a set number of 64 spell cards, consisting of four colors 1-15 and four special = cards.

There are also up to 10 combo cards on the table, like poker roles.

The game is played in a clockwise rotation.

When it is your turn, you must either a) play a Spell Card according to the rules of the Combo Card, or b) play a Time Stop Card. Either of the two is performed.

If neither can be done, the player is eliminated and loses the game.

Since there is almost no hand replenishment, the key point is how to struggle to survive as the situation is getting worse and worse, as the number of cards in hand decreases and the conditions for being able to play combo cards become tougher and tougher.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 跳舞戰爭 (Dancing Battle)
boardgame.description:
We love to play board games and have opened a board game store, but we found that there is no board game in Taiwan or even in the world where you can dance to music and have fun! That's why Dancing Battle, the world's most entertaining dancing board game, was born.

Table game features

The dancers flip over the dancing cards and follow the movements on the cards to dance to the music.
There are various built-in games, such as judging players according to the accuracy of the movements to give points, such as guessing players to answer what card the dancer is dancing, such as dancing mimic solitaire.
The first danceable party game type table game in Taiwan, which is very rare in the world.
Created by Taiwan's elite team of research and development.
People who do not know how to dance can easily play, you can set the level of difficulty, children and the elderly and foreigners can play, the rules are simple five minutes to know.
The original dance rhythm music.


—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Covenant Magick Cards
boardgame.description:
Players! Are you playing a grim & perilous covenant magick user but tired of penciling your spells down on index cards? Then prepare yourself with ZWEIHÄNDER Grim & Perilous RPG: Covenant Magick Cards, created for MAIN GAUCHE Grim & Perilous Supplement.

Decks made for other tabletop role-playing games use standard-sized US & Euro poker cards. Our Covenant Magick cards have been meticulously laid out in tarot card format (2.75" x 4.75") with a matte finish. Beautifully illustrated, each are uniquely color-coded for easy memory and uses a large-sized font for easy reading. Every principle of Magick has been clearly designated from one another using a simple legend: 1 skull for Petty Magick, 2 skulls for Lesser Magick and 3 skulls for Greater Magick. The deck also includes every Generalist Magick spell across the ZWEIHANDER RPG line.

Grab your official ZWEIHÄNDER Grim & Perilous RPG: Covenant Magick Cards today, and prepare yourself for a world of grim & perilous adventure.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Injury & Mishap Cards
boardgame.description:
Gamemasters! Are you running grim & perilous adventures and need help tracking Injuries for your character and Mishaps for vehicles? Then prepare yourself with ZWEIHÄNDER Grim & Perilous RPG: Injury & Mishap Cards, created for MAIN GAUCHE Grim & Perilous Supplement.

Decks made for other tabletop role-playing games use standard-sized US & Euro poker cards. Our Injury & Mishap cards have been meticulously laid out in tarot card format (2.75" x 4.75") with a matte finish. Every Injury & Mishap is clearly designated from one another with color blind-friendly borders and evocative artwork. Plus, these cards can be randomly drawn by players, instead of rolling against the injury or mishap tables by the Gamemaster.

Grab your official ZWEIHÄNDER Grim & Perilous RPG: Injury & Mishap Cards today, and prepare yourself for a world of grim & perilous adventure.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Monster Cards
boardgame.description:
Gamemasters! Are you running grim & perilous adventures and need help tracking the creatures your players are fighting against? Then prepare yourself with ZWEIHÄNDER Grim & Perilous RPG: Monster Cards.

Decks made for other tabletop role-playing games use standard-sized US & Euro poker cards. Our Injury & Mishap cards have been meticulously laid out in tarot card format (2.75" x 4.75") with a matte finish. Every card has the usable stats on the back side of the card, while the front side has an evocative illustration and classification of the creature. Every classification of creature has been color-coded for easy sorting. Best of all, the deck includes all of the creatures in the bestiary, making for a whopping total of 130 cards.

Grab your official ZWEIHÄNDER Grim & Perilous RPG: Monster Cards today, and prepare yourself for a world of grim & perilous adventure.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.description:

Decks made for other tabletop role-playing games use standard-sized US & Euro poker cards. Our Arcane Magick cards have been meticulously laid out in tarot card format (2.75" x 4.75") with a matte finish. The deck also includes every Generalist Magick spell across the ZWEIHANDER RPG line.

Grab your official ZWEIHÄNDER Grim & Perilous RPG: Arcane Magick Cards today, and prepare yourself for a world of grim & perilous adventure.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Divine Magick Cards
boardgame.description:
Players! Are you playing a grim & perilous divine magick user but tired of penciling your spells down on index cards? Then prepare yourself with ZWEIHÄNDER Grim & Perilous RPG: Divine Magick Cards.

Decks made for other tabletop role-playing games use standard-sized US & Euro poker cards. Our Divine Magick cards have been meticulously laid out in tarot card format (2.75" x 4.75") with a matte finish. Beautifully illustrated, each are uniquely color-coded for easy memory and uses a large-sized font for easy reading. Every principle of Magick has been clearly designated from one another using a simple legend: 1 skull for Petty Magick, 2 skulls for Lesser Magick and 3 skulls for Greater Magick. Grab your official ZWEIHÄNDER Grim & Perilous RPG: Divine Magick Cards today, and prepare yourself for a world of grim & perilous adventure.

boardgame.name: Root: Underworld Hirelings Pack
boardgame.description:
Need allies? How much gold do you have? Discover unique strategies and make the Woodland wilder by adding hirelings. Best with fewer players, great with more!

This product includes six new hirelings:

Sunward Expedition and Mole Artisans
Corvid Spies and Raven Sentinels
Furious Protector and Stoic Protector


Hirelings can be added to Root games at any player count. With fewer players, the hirelings add new pieces to the map, ramping up the tension and giving you more tactical options. With more players, some hireling cards will flip over to reveal new special abilities to gain, letting you explore unique and powerful strategies.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 戰古人 (Call of Ancient Fighters)
boardgame.description:
This is a board game based on the idea of "don't open the textbook at dusk", four modern college students (rich kid, school sister, cat girl, silent boy) vs. five ancient people (Mulan, Qin Shi Huang, Mencius, Pu Song Ling, Zhuang Zi), using the Chinese and Western humanities classics to battle.

The game includes map exploration + card battles + camp rivalry, helping each other or framing each other, it's just a matter of thought.

There are 36 debate cards (a collection of 36 different classical ideas from the East and West!), 5 types of 30 disobedience cards, 9 types of 18 contingency cards, 5 Demon King cards, 4 player character cards, 4 summon cards, 15 Demon King partner cards, and a unique triangle map card designed to match the map for exploration.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Game Worldview

Four college students accidentally open the "old Chinese textbook" and fall into a mysterious space.
They are confronted with the obsession kingdom created by five Chinese ancients!
Repeatedly think and reason with the ancient people who are trapped in their obsessions, so that the discourse has power and the words become weapons!

【Game Features
Map Exploration + Card Battles

At the beginning of the game, players will first decide their roles, and then explore the map to collect card resources. While deciding on a character, a "summon card" will also be drawn. The player who draws a summon card becomes a demon king summoned by the Ancients and fights against other players secretly.

When a player reaches the end of the map, the map exploration phase will end and the identity of the Demon King will be revealed.
The next step is to enter a one-on-many card battle, where other players have to join forces to defeat the player who has become the Demon King.
Will the player who becomes the Demon King be inspired by the values of the ancients and win?
Or will the player with modern thinking and debating ability be able to overrule the ancients?

Here comes the battle of ancient and modern arguments!
Debate Card: The wisdom of Eastern and Western classical thought will become the basis of your debate.
The "no contest" card: the slippery slope, the face ......, the modern way of "discussing" things, will become your best trick.
The unexpected event card: in the process of exploring the map, the effect card will be randomly drawn, and you have to sense the direction of the wind in case of emergency!

Five Demons, Five Levels
The five demon lords and five levels are drawn by 葉長青, the artist who won the 2021 Japan International Manga Award, and have both ancient and modern aesthetics.

Mulan
In this game, you designate the size and wind direction of your own card.
Defiant card: 5 effects and one more "symbolic struggle".
Debate card: 3 cards exclusive to Mulan + 4 cards drawn blindly from the debate card pile

Emperor Qin Shi Huang
Invalidate the opponent's disobedience card once.
Disobedience card: 5 effects and 1 more "facepalm" card
Debate cards: 3 cards exclusive to Qin Shi Huang + 4 cards drawn blindly from the debate card pile

Mencius｜I am doing this for you
Replace a card played by your opponent with a blank card.
Defiant card: 5 effects and 1 additional "Karma Blast".
Debate cards: 3 exclusive cards of Mengmu + 4 cards drawn blindly from the debate card pile

Pu Songling
You may replace a card from your hand once after you open a duel.
Defiant card: 5 effects and 1 more "Slip" card
Debate card: 3 cards exclusive to Pu Songling + 4 cards drawn blindly from the debate card pile

Zhuangzi｜Northern Meditation with Fish
1. 1 point of blood is returned at the end of each match
2. not take any damage once
Defiant card: 5 effects and 1 additional "Sleep" card
Debate cards: 3 copies of "Zhuangzi" + 4 blind draws from the debate card pile

Explore the map with the topic!
The map of "Call of Ancient Fighters" combines five issues: gender roles, authority, parenting styles, media literacy, and philosophy of life.

In order to create a richer "educational and fun" experience, both the map design and the play style are intended to combine both the issues and the player's own reading experience.

For example, in the "Mulan" map, we designed three special exploration points: jeans, car keys, and pens. Players need to explore these points and open the map card before they can successfully summon Mulan to appear.

These three exploration points correspond to the "gender roles" we want to convey in this map.
Jeans symbolize the imagination of women who no longer have to conform to a specific feminine temperament.
The fountain pen represents the power of women to speak, to argue, to write, and to enter the public sphere.
The car key is a means of transportation, signifying the independence and mobility of women.

While novels and comics focus more on the plot, the board game is based on the concept of classic humanistic sentences, focusing on the four protagonists, who enter the realm of the Ancients' obsessions and need to defeat them to regain their freedom. The tabletop game is a combination of two modes: map exploration and card battles, plus role-playing and camp battles.

The five ancients (five maps) represent the following issues: Mulan (gender roles), Qin Shi Huang (authority), Mencius (parenting style), Pu Song Ling (media literacy), and Zhuang Zi (philosophy of life).

The cards are divided into two types, one is the "debate cards" which are based on sentences from Chinese humanities classics and Western contemporary thought classics, divided into three main parts: rational, emotional and value, on the one hand, and on the other hand, the cards are played in the way of point size comparison. The second is the "disobedience to battle cards" that use concepts commonly found in modern slang to trigger events or effects, such as: karma detonation, facepalm, slippery slope, etc.

—another description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Wildspire Waste
boardgame.description:
Wildspire Waste is a standalone core set that can also be combined with Ancient Forest for a mega campaign! Hunt any combination of monsters, with any combination of the available hunters.

Wildspire Waste also includes arena quests for Wildspire Waste hunters to take on Ancient Forest monsters in one-shot battles.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Hunter's Arsenal Expansion
Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Kulu-Ya-Ku
Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Teostra Expansion
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game

boardgame.name: Privateers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Privateers is an excessively rules-light tabletop roleplaying game that assumes the player-characters are Privateers in the Age of Sail, government-sponsored soldiers-of-fortune under letters of marque authorizing both hunting pirates and capturing enemy nation’s ships & attacking their colonies.

All you need to play are these rules, a few scraps of paper, pencils, at least two six-sided dice (2d6), and a few friends! One player runs the game as the Gamemaster (GM), while everyone else plays as a Privateer; the more the merrier!

boardgame.name: Fake Chess
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Chess is a game of vast complexity and a 1500-year history.

Fake Chess is not.

Fake Chess players get to act like serious chess players without the burdens of chess strategy, chess tactics, or chess rules.

Live out your grandmaster fantasies … with Fake Chess!

boardgame.name: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Hunter's Arsenal Expansion
boardgame.description:
The weapons you decide to craft, and the monsters you hunt to craft them, will change the path of each campaign you play. Different hunters need different materials, and more hunters means more options!

These hunters introduce six new weapon classes to transform your campaigns, plus arena quests for the Ancient Forest and Wildspire Waste monsters for one-shot play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game
Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Wildspire Waste

boardgame.name: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Teostra Expansion
boardgame.description:
Today, we’re walking straight into the flames.

Taking on Teostra is like challenging the element of fire. Anything that can burn, will burn.

Teostra stalks the Wildspire Waste at will, an emperor of flame.

Find it, hunters, and end its searing reign!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Wildspire Waste
